sentences.sentence: If there was any remaining doubt, Donald Trump is unfit for office.
He has always been a huckster who skates along the boundaries of decorum, rules, and the truth, and frequently beyond.
Now he is the first former president to become a convicted felon.It matters to everyone because the United States is still the leader of the democratic world.

But it will be a confidence-sapping stain on it should a convicted Trump become president again, as many opinion polls imply he might.In another time, cavorting with a porn star would have been career-ending by itself.

Trump has been found guilty of falsifying business records of payments for the silence of Stormy Daniels, and to suppress negative news stories about his sexual encounter with her.The jury has unanimously accepted the prosecution's case that the payments were not to save Trump's private embarrassment, but to deceive voters in the 2016 presidential election about his character.

That broke New York's election laws and meant the falsified records were to cover another crime, making the charges much more serious.Trump frequently seems to think he is above the law, or most other rules.Yet he can rage against the criminal cases brought against him - there are three bigger trials to come - because the law in the US is too often excessively politicised.If the Democrats exploit Trump's conviction too hard, they will fuel that concern.
And the verdict will only encourage Trump's base.

His outrageous behaviour, contempt for establishment norms, and his rhetoric of a broken America channel those who believe everything is rigged and loaded against them.His chilling promise to them that, "I am your retribution...
I am your justice," is only embellished by his own conviction.President Joe Biden now trails in swing states he won in 2020, as voters seem to turn on him.
He is clearly too infirm for the job.

The impressive performance of the US economy and job creation is not offsetting sticky inflation, with no cut in interest rates yet to signal the consumer price shock is over.Trump has sidestepped the abortion issue, critical for women voters, by saying states should decide.
And so far, not enough American voters are buying the democracy versus despotism fight that the Democrats want to frame the election with.
Yet that matters very much to the rest of the world.Most people didn't expect Trump to win in 2016.

This time, he will come with a full cadre of conservative activists and intellectuals who believe that the left has achieved its long march through the institutions and the establishment, from their wokeness to their excessive size and debt.These new insurgents want a counter-revolution, raising tariffs against imports, cutting taxes, slashing public servants and whole departments, and removing perhaps millions of migrants - annoyingly, they have a point on the Democrats' stubborn refusal to control America's southern border.US presidents have enormous powers to decide what constitutes an emergency, and Trump is all about pushing boundaries.
It seems unlikely that even he could overcome America's powerful checks and balances of the states, the courts, and ultimately its famously civic-minded military.

But he has already refused to accept an election he did not win, and he would thrive on creating yet more confrontation and drama.Trump also looks like the worst person to lead the US when the global order is splintering.
His Make America Great Again really means making America just one more normal self-interested state fighting for its own narrow ends.

But America is too big and too exceptional for that.The same United States created and led an international order, an environment in which all states prospered for decades.If that climate of rules disintegrates into a free-for-all, then the US will suffer last, but suffer in the end.
It will suit Russia and China, in a multi-power system where they can throw their weight around on equal terms with the US.
Putting an accomplished rule-breaker back into the White House as well can only bring more foreboding to international matters.

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly uncertain about this document. The writing style and content are not particularly AI-like.
documents.inputText: If there was any remaining doubt, Donald Trump is unfit for office. He has always been a huckster who skates along the boundaries of decorum, rules, and the truth, and frequently beyond. Now he is the first former president to become a convicted felon.It matters to everyone because the United States is still the leader of the democratic world. But it will be a confidence-sapping stain on it should a convicted Trump become president again, as many opinion polls imply he might.In another time, cavorting with a porn star would have been career-ending by itself. Trump has been found guilty of falsifying business records of payments for the silence of Stormy Daniels, and to suppress negative news stories about his sexual encounter with her.The jury has unanimously accepted the prosecution's case that the payments were not to save Trump's private embarrassment, but to deceive voters in the 2016 presidential election about his character. That broke New York's election laws and meant the falsified records were to cover another crime, making the charges much more serious.Trump frequently seems to think he is above the law, or most other rules.Yet he can rage against the criminal cases brought against him - there are three bigger trials to come - because the law in the US is too often excessively politicised.If the Democrats exploit Trump's conviction too hard, they will fuel that concern. And the verdict will only encourage Trump's base. His outrageous behaviour, contempt for establishment norms, and his rhetoric of a broken America channel those who believe everything is rigged and loaded against them.His chilling promise to them that, "I am your retribution ... I am your justice," is only embellished by his own conviction.President Joe Biden now trails in swing states he won in 2020, as voters seem to turn on him. He is clearly too infirm for the job. The impressive performance of the US economy and job creation is not offsetting sticky inflation, with no cut in interest rates yet to signal the consumer price shock is over.Trump has sidestepped the abortion issue, critical for women voters, by saying states should decide.
